page.title: 18 Role of a Hospital Doctor
page.content: Dr.Denis Edwards, the Consultant at the Intensive Care Unit at Withington Hospital came to talk to our class about his job. One boy asked why Dr.Edwards didn't treat private patients or work in a private clinic. He replied that he didn't believe that private medicine was right and so he only treated NHS patients. We were told that life support machines served up to eight patients in the Intensive Care Unit, but it seems that at least half of the patients admitted died of their injuries. It appeared to be rather depressing being a doctor in intensive care especially when Dr.Edwards described some of the worst cases. Dr.Edwards said he got very frustrated about lack of money for much needed equipment and extra nurses
